alert.note: Alert for Colfax (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 1:39PM MDT until June 12 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL COLFAX COUNTY... At 139 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms slowly exiting the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen since overnight. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.50 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Vermejo River, Ponil Creek, Cimarron River, Rayado Creek, Chicorica Creek, Eagle Tail Creek, the Canadian River, Raton, Springer, Cimarron, Maxwell, Raton Crews Airport, Sugarite, Sugarite Canyon State Park and Philmont Scout Ranch. This includes the following highways... Highway 64 between Mile Markers 304 and 360. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 412 and 460. State Roads 21, 58, 72, 445, 505, 526, 555, and Blosser Gap Road. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely.
